intro: Hymenothrix dissecta, commonly known as the dissected hymenothrix, is a rare and delicate fern native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that give it a lacy appearance. The plant has a slender, creeping rhizome and produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori on the undersides of its leaves. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
